text: The Cathedral of Tarragona is a Roman Catholic cathedral in Tarragona, Spain. The site was previously occupied by a Roman temple of Jupiter.Beebe Bahrami, The Spiritual Traveler: Spain : a Guide to Sacred Sites and Pilgrim Routes (Mahwah, NJ: HiddenSpring, 2009), p. 191 Later it was a Visigothic cathedral, then a Moorish mosque. It was declared a national monument in 1905. During the Spanish Civil War the cathedral was vandalized and in 1939 a reconciliation rite was celebrated.Hilari Raguer, Gunpowder and Incense: the Catholic Church and the Spanish Civil War (London: Routledge, 2007), p. 296 == References == == Other websites == *Panoramic view *Diocesan Museum Category:Roman Catholic cathedrals in Spain Category:Buildings and structures in Catalonia Category:12th-century buildings and structures
title: Tarragona Cathedral
